meanings.definition: Necessary for someone as a duty or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: It is incumbent upon us to finish our homework before playing.
meanings.sent2: Studying is an incumbent task for students to succeed in school.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how cleaning your room suddenly becomes incumbent when guests are coming over.
meanings.sent4: The safety of the passengers is incumbent upon the pilot's decisions.
meanings.sent5: Wearing a helmet is incumbent for bikers to protect their heads.

meanings.definition: Currently holding a particular office or position.
meanings.sent1: The incumbent mayor won the election for another term.
meanings.sent2: The incumbent CEO has been leading the company for years.
meanings.sent3: The incumbent teacher always has a cup of coffee on his desk.
meanings.sent4: The incumbent champion defended his title successfully.
meanings.sent5: The incumbent president addressed the nation in a televised speech.

meanings.sent1: Paying taxes is an incumbent responsibility of all citizens.
meanings.sent2: Wearing a seatbelt is incumbent for drivers to ensure safety.
meanings.sent3: It's like an incumbent rule that you have to take off your shoes before entering the house.
meanings.sent4: The incumbent curfew for teenagers is midnight in this town.
meanings.sent5: Following the traffic rules is incumbent to avoid accidents.
